qas.question: Which 1980 movie contained song contributions from Queen?
Which 1986 movie contained a Queen theme song?
In what year was Bohemian Rhapsody re-released in the US?
How high did the 1992 Bohemian Rhapsody chart?

context: Queen contributed music directly to the films <a0_0>Flash Gordon<a0_0/> (1980), with "Flash" as the theme song, and <a1_0>Highlander<a1_0/> (the original 1986 film), with "A Kind of Magic", "One Year of Love", "Who Wants to Live Forever", "Hammer to Fall", and the theme "Princes of the Universe", which was also used as the theme of the Highlander TV series (1992–1998). In the United States, "Bohemian Rhapsody" was re-released as a single in <a2_0>1992<a2_0/> after appearing in the comedy film Wayne's World. The single subsequently reached number <a3_0>two<a3_0/> on the Billboard Hot 100 (with "The Show Must Go On" as the first track on the single) and helped rekindle the band's popularity in North America.
